multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; tariff negotiations on dairy and wine between India and Australia imply shifts in agricultural commodity flows and pricing, with potential spillovers to broader commodity markets and risk sentiment.

category.motivation: India’s rejection of Australia’s request for deeper tariff cuts on dairy and wine is an official policy statement concerning trade policy between the two countries.

impact.motivation: The article reports a major event affecting India’s trade policy and agricultural sector, impacting domestic producers and the nascent wine industry.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a recent decision by India that directly affects trade negotiations and tariff policy.

article_node.title: India, Australia trade talks hit dairy, wine tariff hurdles as year-end deadline looms, say sources
article_node.summary: India has rejected Australia’s request for deeper tariff cuts on dairy and wine, stalling the finalisation of the second phase of the Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement.  The move reflects pressure from powerful Indian farm groups and concerns over the impact on farmers and the nascent wine industry.  Australia seeks faster reductions and broader access for dairy products, while India maintains that further concessions would hurt its agricultural sector and domestic producers.
